Hey y’all, it’s #FollowFriday! Can we get newly appointed Assistant @Chief_Henderson 100 followers today? She’s awesome, kind and new to Twitter!
***UPDATE*** Bluff Springs Rd. is now open. #ATXTraffic -WC6
We are unsure at this time if there will be a briefing. However, if there is a briefing, information and time will be posted through Twitter.
***UPDATE*** Media, staging area will be the AE/LCRA parking lot at Bluff Springs Rd./Bitter Creek Dr. on the West curb line.

Officers are on the scene of a traffic fatality in the 6700 Blk. of Bluff Springs Rd. Bluff Springs is shut down in both directions at that location. Expect traffic delays as investigation continues. PIO is not responding. Media, stand by for staging area. #ATXTraffic -WC6
***UPDATE*** ALL LANES of S IH-35 Southbound proper in the 6200 Blk. are now open. Thank you for your patience. #ATXTraffic -WC6

Officers are on the scene of a crash in the 6200 Blk. S IH-35 Southbound proper and ALL LANES are shut down (Southbound only). Traffic is being diverted off at the William Cannon exit. Watch for lane closures and officers on scene. Updates to follow. #ATXTraffic -WC6
Bomb threat at 8627 Research Blvd service road Norrhbound
***UPDATE*** Intersection to remain closed through rush hour. Still no estimated time for repair completion. #ATXTraffic

**Update: Suspicious Package Call** Both NB & SB service roads closed at Ohlen Rd. SWAT on scene, PIO en-route. Avoid the area; expect delays. Media meet at staging location: 8716 Research Blvd. #ATXTraffic
Media can stage at 8716 Research Blvd (near FAMSA Furniture).

APD is responding to a suspicious package call in the 8600 block of Research Blvd Svrd NB. 183 NB at Ohlen is closed. Traffic is being diverted to Fairfield. The call came in at 2:32 p.m. Incident #200371016 NOI #ATXtraffic
TRAFFIC ADVISORY: Intersections of Springdale Rd w/ Pecan Brook Dr; Old Manor Rd closed due to a gas line break. PD on scene, please avoid the area. No ETA for reopening at this time. #ATXTraffic
We had a fantastic time at #CoffeeWithACop — thanks to everyone who came out this morning to meet with your downtown officers. #OneAustinSaferTogether – at Starbucks

Good morning! Join our downtown district rep. officers for #CoffeeWithACop today at 8 a.m.! We're excited to meet you to discuss anything from the weather to crime in the area. Hope to see you there! #OneAustinSaferTogether #CommunityPolicing #CommunityEngagement
***UPDATE*** Two lanes closed in the 9200 Blk. of E US 290 HWY WB (coming into Austin from Manor/Elgin) due to icy conditions. Please use caution. #ATXTraffic #ATXwx -WC6

***UPDATE*** Additional reports of icy elevated road surfaces continue coming in from throughout the city. Please use caution when driving. As of now, The N Capital of TX overpass over N Mopac is closed. TXDOT is working on treating reported icy roads. #ATXTraffic #ATXwx -WC6

Icy road conditions are being reported at the W. Braker Ln. overpass over Mopac Expwy., and the N. Capitial of TX HWY overpass and U-Turn over Mopac Expwy. Please use caution when driving on roadways. TXDOT is responding to put sand down on roads. #ATXTraffic #ATXwx -WC6
#whatthehelicopter AIR1 responding to the area of 5900 Blk Alsace Trl to assist in a search for a missing child. WC4

Did you remember to remove valuables from your car? Never leave guns, purses, wallets or electronics in the car. Always take your keys and lock the doors. Have a great night, Austin! Remember to call 9-1-1 if you see suspicious activity. #OneAustinSaferTogether #LockItOrLoseIt
#whatthehelicopter AIR1 responding to the area of 3900 Blk Oak Creek Dr to assist in a search for a missing elderly female. WC4

Congratulations to newly promoted communications supervisor Jennie Knight! She recently received her five-year pin — Thank you, Jennie, for your years of dedicated service. You are appreciated! #OneAustinSaferTogether #IAm911
Hey Austin, help keep your pets safe. Please remember to bring them indoors where it's nice and warm. #OneAustinSaferTogether
Yes! We do regularly. Hope to see your application soon!
APD news conference regarding a 2017 sexual assault of a child case where a person of interest has been identified.

Do you want to exercise outdoors tonight? Join Downtown Officers at 6 p.m. tonight for a 3-mile run! Meetup at The Loop Running Supply off Sandra Muraida Way. Parking will be validated after the run! Hope to see you there. #CommunityPolicing #RunATX #OneAustinSaferTogether

Did your pet run away or get lost somehow? Please visit the Austin Animal Center off Levander Loop to see if it has been brought to the shelter. Also, remember to bring your pets indoors as temperatures drop. Thank you for helping to keep #OneAustinSaferTogether. @austinanimals

APD seeking assistance in locating a person of interest in sexual assault of a child case - https://mailchi.mp/austintexas/apd-seeking-assistance-in-locating-a-person-of-interest-in-sexual-assault-of-a-child-case
Kudos to everyone who remembered to remove valuables from your car! Be safe, Austin. #9pmRoutine #LockItOrLoseIt

Do you live or work in downtown Austin? Join our DTAC District Reps. for Coffee With A Cop this Thursday at the Starbucks located at 10th & Congress! We want to meet you and learn what safety concerns you have. Let's work to make #OneAustinSaferTogether! #CommunityPolicing

Do you live or work near E Riverside? Join us this Thursday for Coffee With A Cop at the HEB Plus on Riverside! We'll be there from 7:30 - 9:30 a.m. to discuss any safety concerns that you may have. We look forward to meeting you! #OneAustinSaferTogether #CoffeeWithACop

APD seeks assistance in locating suspect in attempted Aggravated Sexual Assault, Kidnapping of a Child investigation - https://mailchi.mp/austintexas/apd-seeks-assistance-in-locating-suspect-in-attempted-aggravated-sexual-assault-kidnapping-of-a-child-investigation
Bank Robbery at Chase bank located at 13809 US Highway 183 service road northbound

***Crime Stoppers Fugitive of the Week*** Do you know where Augustine Garza is? @CrimeStopATX could pay up to $1,000 for any tips leading to his arrest. Mr. Garza has an outstanding felony warrant for engaging in organized criminal activity. #OneAustinSaferTogether

APD is responding to a bank robbery at the Chase Bank, 13809 N. U.S. Highway 183 Case #20-350895. Senior Police Officer Destiny Silva will provide a media briefing at 2 p.m. at or near the parking lot of the bank.

APD and surrounding agency officers want to engage with Austin youth by playing a game that teaches them how to navigate interactions with police officers. If you’d like to have this program at your school or activity center, please contact Ofc. Bohannon! #CommunityPolicing

Do you live or work in NE Austin? Please join the Edward Sector District Representatives tonight for our Quarterly Community Engagement Meeting! We will be at High Pointe Baptist Church located at 12030 Dessau Rd. from 6 - 8 p.m. Hope to see you all there! #CommunityEngagement

Hey #FortHood! Friendly reminder that APD Recruiting will be at the Education Center today from 9:30 - 11:30 a.m. Come talk to Sr. Officer Bryant, Retired 1st Sergeant with the @USArmy, and see how your future could be with our APD family. See you soon! #OneAustinSaferTogether

Hello Austin, it’s Cpl. Paredes reminding you to drive safely! Whether you’re driving to work or dropping the kids off at school, always wear a seatbelt — Every passenger, every ride. #ClickItOrTicket #ArriveAlive #OneAustinSaferTogether #ASL #SignLanguage
***UPDATE*** Suspect was not located. Officers are securing the perimeter and going back in service. -WC6
APD AIR1 is headed to the area of E. William Cannon Dr. and S. Pleasant Valley Rd. to assist in the search for a suspect who fled from a traffic stop. Updates to follow. #whatthehelicopter -WC6
Hey ATX— Remember to remove valuables from your car, take your keys and lock the doors! Have a great night and be safe. #9PMRoutine #LockItOrLoseIt

Our DTAC officers would like to thank the students at Cathedral School of Saint Mary! We received your kind thank you notes and prayers to keep us safe. You all made our day. #OneAustinSaferTogether – at Austin Police Department Headquarters

Hello, Fort Hood! I’m Ofc. Kelvin Bryant with the APD Recruiting Unit, Retired 1st Sergeant with the US Army. If you’re looking for a career in law enforcement, meet us tomorrow at the Ft. Hood Education Center from 9:30 - 11:30 a.m. Hope to see you there! @JoinAPD

Austin PD presents the Juvenile Justice Jeopardy Game to Improve Youth Understanding of Interactions with Police & Peers - https://mailchi.mp/austintexas/austin-pd-presents-the-juvenile-justice-jeopardy-game-to-improve-youth-understanding-of-interactions-with-police-peers

Join us this Thursday at the Starbucks off 10th and Congress for Coffee With A Cop! Downtown District Rep. Officers will be available to answer questions on public safety and crime. Hope to see you there! #OneAustinSaferTogether #CommunityPolicing
Heading home? If you’ve been drinking don’t get behind the wheel. Have a plan to get home safely. #ArriveAlive
Always remove valuables such as guns, electronics, purses, keys or money from the car. Have a great night and be safe. #LockItOrLoseIt #9pmRoutine #OneAustinSaferTogether
***UPDATE*** Ms. Esparza-Torres has been located.

Julia Esparza-Torres was last seen around the South Austin area wearing a black beanie, red/yellow jacket, white shirt and gray pants. She is able to communicate in Spanish. Please call APD if you have information on her whereabouts. PIO-9
Missing elderly woman. Have you seen this woman? If so, please call 9-1-1.

It doesn't matter which team you're cheering for. We're more worried about your safety. If you plan on drinking, have a plan to get home safely. Never drink and drive. #OneAustinSaferTogether #ArriveAlive
@JoinAPD @Lt_WadeLyons

Let’s be safe, Austin! Never drink and drive. Always have a plan to #ArriveAlive. (Pictured: APD Sr. Officer T. Griffin & Fair Oaks Ranch Officer C. Griffin welcome their sister Officer S. Griffin to law enforcement! She graduated from APD’s Training Academy on Friday.)
If you're planning on drinking this afternoon, make sure that you have a plan to get home safely. Never drink and drive! #ArriveAlive #VisionZero

La encuesta es anónima y solo debe tomarle unos cinco minutos. Si tiene alguna pregunta, comuníquese con el gerente de auditorías, Andrew Keegan, a través de andrew.keegan@austintexas.gov.

La Oficina del Auditor de la Ciudad de Austin solicita su opinión sobre los esfuerzos de vigilancia policial comunitaria del APD. Su opinión nos ayudará a entender qué tan bien sirve APD a la comunidad y a mejorar sus servicios. https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/YRJJD6X?lang=es
The survey is anonymous and should take about five minutes. If you have any questions about completing the survey, please contact the audit manager, Andrew Keegan at andrew.keegan@austintexas.gov.

The Office of the City Auditor is requesting your input on the Austin Police Department’s community policing efforts. Your input will help us understand how well APD serves the community and identify opportunities for APD to improve its services. https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/YRJJD6X

If there is a threat to life or property, always call 9-1-1. If in doubt, you can always call 9-1-1.

Dial 9-1-1 immediately for: • Someone breaking into a home/vehicle • Collisions with injuries and/or blocking roadways • Physical/Verbal disturbances • Weapons being brandished or used in a threatening manner • Medical or Fire emergencies #OneAustin #SaferTogether

When do you call 3-1-1 versus 9-1-1? Dial 3-1-1 to report: • Loud noise • Lost property (cell phones, wallets, etc.) • Parking violations • Vandalism or damage to property • Burglarized vehicles (not in progress) #OneAustin #SaferTogether

Hello! It's a Texas Rat Snake and it was caught near Harris Branch Blvd and Magnus Street on May 2nd, 2018. We posted this as a PSA since we recently had heavy rain and snakes tend to come out after the rain. Be safe!

Officer Cummins would like to remind everyone that snakes come out this time of year, especially after rain. Please be on the lookout! You can call 9-1-1 if you find one and our snake-handler trained officers will do everything they can to safely relocate the snake. #AustinPD

Did you know? 16 of the last 20 auto thefts that occurred in S. ATX either had keys left inside them and/or the vehicle was left running. Never leave your car running while unattended, even just for a minute. Car thieves often look for vehicles with keys in the ignition. #Safety
